reviews.title: A serene and beautiful beach getaway in a clean, comfortable hotel in a great location.
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 7 de julio de 2025
reviews.positive_feedback: This was my second stay at La Tolita. I came back because I really enjoyed my stay when I stayed here the first time and I had a just as amazing stay this time. The hostel is family-owned and the family and staff that run it are so friendly and welcoming. They do all they can to ensure you have a great stay. The location is amazing, right on the beach, and the beach felt private, calm, safe, and serene. The beach in the vicinity of the hotel tends to be less crowded in my experience so this hotel is perfect for anyone seeking a quiet beach getaway. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the pricing is a great value. There is a restaurant on site with amazing seafood and breakfast that is also very reasonably priced. Cannot recommend it enough!

reviews.title: I might consider staying there again, but in a different apartment.
reviews.date: Fecha del comentario: 1 de septiembre de 2025
reviews.negative_feedback: The  property needs a lot of maintenance.   The apartment we stayed in was in bad repair and had water leaks in the bathrooms, no toilet paper, only two towels for 5 people (the place could sleep 8 people or more), no air conditioning and the lights outside the apartment door were burned out so we couldn't see how to use the keys to get into the apartment.
reviews.positive_feedback: The apartment building was at the opposite end of the beach from the shops and restaurants, so it was more quiet and not so many people.   It was a nice walk to the restaurants and vendors.  the pool was very nice.   There was a person on duty 24x7 and there is secure parking for your car.  There is also a shower in the parking garage area to rinse off before you go upstairs to your room if you have been to the beach, or before you go to the swimming pool.   The swimming pool area has plenty of shaded seating and is clean and well kept.
